title: Bulgaria 0-6 England PLAYER RATINGS: Sterling was a constant menace but Henderson drifted in and out
text:
Gareth Southgate's men stood firm in the face of sickening racism as England thrashed Bulgaria on a night of shame in Sofia.

The Three Lions took a giant stride towards Euro 2020 as they bounced back from Friday's shock loss in the Czech Republic, yet this will match will be remembered for all the wrong reasons.

Nazi salutes and racist chanting marred Monday's thumping 6-0 win in Bulgaria, where Marcus Rashford and Harry Kane goals complemented braces from Ross Barkley and Raheem Sterling as the players showed great dignity in finishing the match.

Sportsmail's Sami Mokbel rated the players.

Forward Raheem Sterling scored twice as England thrashed Bulgaria on Monday night

Jordan Pickford 6

An early save from Ivelin Popov stung his hands but this was a largely comfortable night.

Kieran Trippier 6.5

Kept his place ahead of Trent Alexander-Arnold. Didn’t do enough to cement his spot.

Harry Maguire 7

Relatively little to do. Comfortable when called upon and his composure helped Mings settle.

Tyrone Mings 7

Looked confident during a debut which was overshadowed for being targeted by racist abuse.

Tyrone Mings stood tall and did not put a foot wrong on a difficult night for the defender

Ben Chilwell 6.5

A performance built on attacking intent. Linked well with Rashford and was defensively sound.

Jordan Henderson 6

On tenterhooks from the outset after an early booking but managed to keep his discipline.

Harry Winks 8

England’s midfield looks more composed and controlled with him in it. Has to be a fixture.

Ross Barkley 8.5

Recalled and repaid Southgate with the second and third. His goals capped a fine game.

Ross Barkley capped a fine night for the Chelsea midfielder by scoring twice in Sofia

Raheem Sterling 9

A constant menace. Showed just how potent he is in front of goal once again.

Harry Kane 8

Led by example when players were subjected to racist chanting. Also led the line admirably.

Marcus Rashford 7

A stunning finish to fire England ahead — he appears to have his spark back.

SUBSTITUTES

Mount 6 (for Barkley 73min) Sancho 6 (for Sterling 73) Wilson (for Rashford 76)

Not used: Pope, D Henderson, Alexander-Arnold, Gomez, Keane, Rice, Tomori, Abraham.
description: SAMI MOKBEL AT VASIL LEVSKI NATIONAL STADIUM: Gareth Southgate's men stood firm in the face of sickening racism as England thrashed Bulgaria on a night of shame .
authors: Sami Mokbel For The Daily Mail
